Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is lightly covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of at least one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394638) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394638)
